page.title: 16Unusual Birds of Portsmouth
page.content: { }In{Great Salterns Lake,}breeding birds include Sedge and Reed Warblers, Redshank, Whitethroat, Reedbunting, Mallard, Moorhen, Coot, Linnet and Goldfinches. There are interesting migrants such as the Tufter Duck, Pochard, Stonechat, and Brent Geese. In October 1984 the lake had three unusual birds: a Red-necked, and a Grey Phalarope, as well as a Cetti's warbler. {By the sea,}Purple Sandpipers and Red-necked, Great Crested, Black- necked and Slavonian Grebes winter. In Southsea itself in Chetwynd Road a Rose-coloured starling (very rare) spent 3 weeks from April to May 1985. {Langstone Harbour}is a winter habitat for 5,000 Brent geese, 2,500 Shelduck and Widgeon, 2,500 Redshank and 10,000 Dunlin. -Robert Clay:Portsmouth Grammar School
